Posts.EditableText: Hello folks, I haven't been active here for some time, but I haven't forgotten about the community or completely disappeared. I've been hitchhiking around extensively, and my work during the summer takes me away from a home or regular wifi hotspots. I'd search more right now for a copy of this, but I don't really have the time and I'd like to continue working on my projects. I've had to redo them several times from hard drive failures, boredom, or other stupid behaviours on my part. I've never properly worked with Quest 5 and it looks much, much different than Quest 4 and previous versions. Is there a copy of the documentation that I'd be able to peruse offline without having to manually copy each HTML page separately? I would if I had the time Thanks for reading, and I hope to remain a part of this community, albeit less regularly. Alex, feel free to remove me from the moderator list if you'd wish. I'm still around, but I really won't have the time to do any moderator activities for some time. Life calls, I'm afraid
Posts.HTML:
Hello folks,

I haven't been active here for some time, but I haven't forgotten about the community or completely disappeared. I've been hitchhiking around extensively, and my work during the summer takes me away from a home or regular wifi hotspots. I'd search more right now for a copy of this, but I don't really have the time and I'd like to continue working on my projects. I've had to redo them several times from hard drive failures, boredom, or other stupid behaviours on my part.

I've never properly worked with Quest 5 and it looks much, much different than Quest 4 and previous versions. Is there a copy of the documentation that I'd be able to peruse offline without having to manually copy each HTML page separately? I would if I had the time

Thanks for reading, and I hope to remain a part of this community, albeit less regularly. Alex, feel free to remove me from the moderator list if you'd wish. I'm still around, but I really won't have the time to do any moderator activities for some time. Life calls, I'm afraid

Posts.EditableText: I wouldnt mind a copy of the documentation either, I support this.
Posts.HTML: I wouldnt mind a copy of the documentation either, I support this.

Posts.EditableText: So far there is just the wiki that has syntax references and a tutorial: http://www.quest5.net/wiki

Posts.EditableText:
I suppose I'll assemble a copy of this for offline use when I have some time and more than five minutes on the Internet. I believe I've got a few days off work next week, but wifi? No idea yet...

Thanks for the info, good sirs. I'll hopefully be around more often this autumn and winter.
